Graph

Class ListGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • Graph.AbstractGraph
      • Graph.ListGraph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Graph

    public class ListGraph
extends AbstractGraph
    A ListGraph is an extension of the AbstractGraph abstract class that uses an array of lists to represent the edges.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.List<Edge>[] edges
      An array of Lists to contain the edges that originate with each vertex.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ListGraph(int numV, boolean directed)
      Construct a graph with the specified number of vertices and directionality.

      • getEdge

        public Edge getEdge(int source,
                    int dest)

        Parameters:

        dest - The destination

      • is_connected

        public static boolean is_connected(ListGraph g,
                                   int v1,
                                   int v2)
        Determine if there is any path between vertex v 1 and vertex v 2 in graph g. If v1 or v2 are not in g then throw an error.
        Parameters:
        g - given graph
        v1 - first vertex
        v2 - second vertex
        Returns:
        if connected return true, otherwise return false
